column4: abdul|linuxnewbi: the reason it isn't working is because it isn't archived properly.  If you really want this one I can walk you through it, want to do that?
yes
how about this one : http://www.gnome-look.org/content/show.php?content=37533
walk me through that one please.
ok is it on your desktop now?
yes
right click on it and press 'extract here'
ok i did that
ok, now open nautilus: places > home
nautilus? its just a folder directory right?
yeah, nautilus is the file browser.  Now press ctrl-h and you should see hidden stuff.  If the '.themes' directory does not exist, create it.
it does exsist

great, double click to open it.  Then go back to your desktop and open the .themes folder that is there.  Then copy the folder called 'Ubuntulooks-Orange-smooth' to your .themes in your home directory that you opened before
when i extracted the tar.gz folder with the theme it showed a folder called user; inside is : share/themes/Ubuntulooks-Orange-smooth  and two other folders, i dont see a .theme folder
ok, just copy Ubuntulooks-Orange-smooth to your .themes
ok i did that
now go to system > prefs > themes and it should be there
its not there, do i have to restart ?
go to details and look at controls and window border, it should be there
thanks alot jason
np
your the best mon, i really appreciate it
most themes should work jsut by dragging, but this one wasn't put in the tar.gz correctly.  So just open it up and see what you see, usually there is a README of some kind
